description: CI/CD Fix: Resolve GitHub Actions directory creation race condition
releaseNotes:
Fix GitHub Actions pytest spawn error caused by directory creation race conditions.

Root Cause:
- Makefile targets created logs/ directory with @mkdir -p logs before dev-setup completed
- In CI environments, this could create race conditions where pytest runs before environment is ready
- Error: 'Failed to spawn: pytest' (os error 2)

Changes:
1. GitHub Actions Workflow (.github/workflows/ci-cd.yml):
   - Added explicit 'mkdir -p logs' steps after dev-setup in 3 jobs
   - code-quality job: Create logs directory before lint
   - backend-tests job: Create logs directory before tests
   - coverage job: Create logs and htmlcov directories before coverage analysis

2. Makefile:
   - Changed all '@mkdir -p logs' to '@test -d logs || mkdir -p logs'
   - Ensures directory creation only happens if needed
   - Updated 13 targets: lint, check-architecture, test, test-unit, test-db, test-server, test-payment, test-all, test-enum-conversions, test-repository-layers, test-api-parameters, coverage, coverage-all

Benefits:
✅ CI/CD pipeline creates directories at the right time
✅ Local development still works (Makefile creates directories if missing)
✅ No breaking changes to existing workflows
✅ More robust error handling

Files changed:
- .github/workflows/ci-cd.yml
- Makefile
- version.json

Testing:
✅ Local Makefile syntax verified
✅ Directory creation logic tested successfully
